alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 19 at 2:47PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Heavy Rains Forecast Monday night and Tuesday... ...Flooding Potential Increasing... The storm system forecast to hit early next week looks a lot like this past heavy rain system, which ended up producing fairly widespread 2 to 4 inch amounts and some localized higher totals. These rains caused flooding issues across the area and combined with recent snowmelt, contributed to water runoff into our rivers and tributaries, resulting in significant water level rises and river flooding. The current forecast is for 1 to 3 inches of rain to be fairly widespread, but thunderstorms will make localized higher totals a likely occurrence especially across portions of southeast Missouri into west Kentucky. We anticipate these higher totals accumulating on recently saturated grounds will lead to flooding issues again across the area. And there is little doubt this rainfall, combined with more upstream snowmelt, will produce additional rises in area rivers and tributaries, leading to more expansive river flooding as well. Stay tuned to the latest forecasts and updates for this pending early week flooding potential.

area.areaDesc: Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick
